answers.answer: Fruit but be careful since fruit has natural sugar in it
Yea. I'm too scared to eat fruits.
Any thing that has a good source of fiber n protein in it
Stay away from carbs, drink lots water,  eats plenty veggies, fruit is good just in moderation
You can still eat sweets just in moderation. I eat chocolate all the time as a diabetic just look at the carbs closely!

After you start checking your sugars, you'll notice what you can and can't have. Some foods cause sugar spikes in some people but are perfectly fine for others. I can eat anything and be fine. It's sugary drinks that spike mine, hence why I failed the glucose test miserably. All sugar and no real nutritional value.
I'm embarrassed to say that I am not good at reading labels. Idk what's good or bad. As far as carbs and sugar levels

I got diagnosis at 24 weeks with it. I am a heavy women in general started out at 235 not at 38 weeks pregnant I'm 275. And I never a lot of sweets but with every meal that u eat only take in 30 carbs. Breakfast 45 carbs, snack, lunch 30 carbs,  snack then dinner 30 carbs then snack. You can eat all the protein u want too just not carbs or sugar.

question: Hello I just been diagnosed with pregnancy diabetes. Can any one please tell me any positive things? I literally have a hard time dealing with this. I was 125 before I got pregnant and now I weigh 165 and I gained this in abou 3 mnths. I never ate a bunch of sweets and now because I know I can't have them it's all I want. I dont want to lose my daughter. I am 29 weeks and I love her so much. What are good foods to eat?
title: gestational diabetis
